channel.title: Help me make this command

item.title: Help me make this command
item.dc:creator: @jman7 jman7
item.description:
@jman7 wrote:

no no i dont want a refesh i want a rebirth. i thank u for helping me and will add it for people who want it but i just want it to count how many times youve used it and say it to everyone that so and so has rebirthed so and so times.

i am wondering if it would just be “+ playername +” has rebirthed __ times
but i dont know what to add there (__)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 17, 2009, 07:45:39 pm[/size][hr]ok well with a message all could i do this

if(command.startsWith(“rebirth”)) {
for(int j=0; j<21; j++)
playerLevel[j] >= 99 ? setSkillXP(0, j, playerXP[j]) : sendMessage(“All your skills must be 99.”);
//timesDone += 1;
showInterface(3559);
sendMessage(“GOOD LUCK IN THE NEXT LIFE.”);
yell//"[+ playername +] has rebirthed + (need help here!) + of times
}
}
[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 17, 2009, 08:15:01 pm[/size][hr]can some one help me?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 18, 2009, 12:01:04 pm[/size][hr]so is this right anyone? does anyone know the method i would have to use for a rebirthing process that after every rebirth adds a little bonus for like str or something

item.title: Help me make this command
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

[quote="`Rich, post:20, topic:283064"] if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("refill")) { int skillLevel = -1; for (int i : playerLevel) { skillLevel++; if (i == getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillLevel])) { continue; } setSkillLevel(skillLevel, getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillLevel]), playerXP[skillLevel]); } sendMessage("You have been refreshed."); }

That will make all of your levels to there max (it will refresh your drained stats, such as prayer, etc).[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: Help me make this command
item.dc:creator: @jman7 jman7
item.description:
@jman7 wrote:

so command would look like this

[code]
if(command.startsWith(“rebirth”)) {
for(int j=0; j<21; j++)
setSkillXP(playerLevel[j] >= 99 ? 0, j, playerXP[j] : getXPForLevel(playerLevel[j]), j, playerXP[j]);
//timesDone += 1;
showInterface(3559);
sendMessage(“New life, kid.”);
}
}

item.title: Help me make this command
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

playerLevel[j] >= 99 ? setSkillXP(0, j, playerXP[j]) : sendMessage(“All your skills must be 99.”);

To

setSkillXP(playerLevel[j] >= 99 ? 0, j, playerXP[j] : getXPForLevel(playerLevel[j]), j, playerXP[j]);

Try that

item.title: Help me make this command
item.dc:creator: @jman7 jman7
item.description:
@jman7 wrote:

ok so itll look like these for the 2 commands.

[code]
if(command.startsWith(“rebirth”)) {
for(int j=0; j<21; j++)
playerLevel[j] >= 99 ? setSkillXP(0, j, playerXP[j]) : sendMessage(“All your skills must be 99.”);
//timesDone += 1;
showInterface(3559);
sendMessage(“New life, kid.”);
}
}

[code/]
and to make sure all ure all stats are truly back to 0

[code/]
if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“refill”))
{
int skillLevel = -1;
for (int i : playerLevel)
{
skillLevel++;
if (i == getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillLevel]))
{
continue;
}
setSkillLevel(skillLevel, getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillLevel]), playerXP[skillLevel]);
}
sendMessage(“You have been refreshed.”);
}

[code/]

now can someone help me find out how to make sure it adds bonuses(were i put the method is what i think he meens by that, and what the method/s is)[/code]

item.title: Help me make this command
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“jman7, post:22, topic:283064”]sorry but can u explain what this does a little better?
if it makes it so urstats doent say 99 on the other fraction could u add that into the rebirth command above please?
im trying to limit the space in wich i use for client.java to reduce lag.[/quote]
The client class can be 50 megabytes in size, but if none of the code is being activated and processed, your server won’t lag.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me make this command
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

The size of the file won’t create lag, it’s what you’re processing that will.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @jman7 jman7
item.description:
@jman7 wrote:

so like this

[code]
if(command.startsWith(“rebirth”)) {
for(int j=0; j<21; j++)
playerLevel[j] >= 99 ? setSkillXP(0, j, j) : sendMessage(“All your skills must be 99.”);
timesDone += 1;
for(int k=0; k<21; k++)
setSkillLevel(0, k, playerXP[k]);
showInterface(3559); (---- is that right way to add the char interface with gendr + looks change?
sendMessage(“New life, kid.”);
}
}

item.title: Help me make this command
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("refill")) { int skillLevel = -1; for (int i : playerLevel) { skillLevel++; if (i == getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillLevel])) { continue; } setSkillLevel(skillLevel, getLevelForXP(playerXP[skillLevel]), playerXP[skillLevel]); } sendMessage("You have been refreshed."); }

That will make all of your levels to there max (it will refresh your drained stats, such as prayer, etc).

item.title: Help me make this command

item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

If you give me your client.java, you do no work, and don’t learn.

The command is good, as long as you put it under public void customCommand(String command) {
For adding bonuses, I’m sure you could just add, in the command, under setSkillXP, playerBonus[whatever] += amount;

item.title: Help me make this command
item.dc:creator: @o.O_O.o o.O O.o
item.description:
@o.O_O.o wrote:

Oh.

if(command.startsWith("rebirth")) { for(int j=0; j<21; j++) if(playerLevel[j] >= 99) { timesDone += 1; for(int k=0; k<21; k++) setSkillLevel(0, k, playerXP[k]); sendMessage("New life, kid."); } }

Somethin like that. Someone can correct me on my placement though, if it’s wrong
